title: Information Types in Product Reviews
author: Ori Shapira (OriginAI), Yuval Pinter (Ben-Gurion University of the Negev)
relevance_why: This paper's exploration of communicative goals in product reviews could inform techniques for enhancing audio or speech data annotation. By understanding the types of information in reviews, similar frameworks could be developed for capturing nuanced audio characteristics or user experiences in datasets.
background: The paper studies various types of information conveyed in product reviews to enhance text classification tasks.
contribution: The authors introduce a typology of 24 communicative goals in product reviews to improve understanding and downstream applications of review data.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior methods often focus on sentiment analysis and aspect extraction without a comprehensive typology for information types.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work provides a detailed classification that combines subjective, objective, stylistic, and functional types of information, leading to more nuanced analyses.

key_innovation: Establishing a systematic typology for understanding the diverse communicative goals present in product reviews.
real_world_impact: This framework can enhance user experience on e-commerce platforms by enabling better information filtering and recommendation systems. It helps potential customers assess product reviews more effectively.
limitations: The typology may not cover all possible sentence types or contexts in reviews, and current zero-shot classification methods could introduce noise in the results.

new_terms.typology: **Typology** refers to a systematic classification of types or categories used to analyze complex information, in this case, the types of information conveyed in product reviews.

open_sourcing: Code and resources are available at https://github.com/OriShapira/InfoTypes
